intro: Dialium connaroides, commonly known as the African mango or butter fruit, is a tropical tree native to Central and West Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The fruit is a drupe with a thick, fleshy exterior that encases a single seed. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. The plant is valued for its edible fruit and has traditional medicinal uses in various African cultures.
